about.title: About the GFR Calculator
about.description: The Glomerular Filtration Rate (GFR) calculator estimates how well your kidneys are filtering waste from your blood. It's a key indicator of kidney health and is used to detect and monitor chronic kidney disease (CKD).
about.gfrExplanation: GFR measures how much blood passes through the glomeruli (tiny filters in the kidneys) each minute. A normal GFR is 90 or above. A GFR below 60 for three months or more indicates chronic kidney disease. The lower the GFR, the worse the kidney function.
about.equationExplanation: The CKD-EPI (Chronic Kidney Disease Epidemiology Collaboration) equation is the most widely used method for estimating GFR. The 2021 version removed race as a factor, making it more equitable. It uses your age, gender, and serum creatinine level to estimate kidney function.
about.note1: This calculator is most accurate for adults 18 years and older
about.note2: Results may be less accurate in people with extreme body sizes, severe malnutrition, or muscle diseases
about.note3: A single GFR result is not enough to diagnose kidney disease - monitoring over time is important
about.note4: Other factors like protein in urine and kidney damage also determine CKD stage
